p.s: After summarising the arguments of Macbeth and Lady Macbeth it is interesting to analyse how Lady Macbeth tries to persuade her husband especially with regard to her choice of language, including stylistic devices.
From line 8 to 18 Lady Macbeth is only using questions to convince Macbeth about her opinion.
She does it to provoke him by mocking his fear or killing DucanDuncan.
There is a metaphor in line 18: Like the poor cat i'th'adage?.
This sentence should illustrate Macbeth's behavior, that he is too lazy or too cowardly to work for his dreams.

Neither time nor the place were right then, yet you said you wished they were, so you said you could act(ll. 28) is an antithesis, which the Lady uses to highlight how contradictory his actions and sayings are.
He says he will do it if the time is right but will not do it if the time is right.
She makes him clear that he should not promise something he would never do.

By telling him that she would do anything she promised him if he would also do (ll. 33) she puts him under pressure and shows that she is a very loyal person to Macbeth but he does not give his best to be also loyal to her.
It also gives the man the feeling of connection that he is not alone and always has his woman on his side.
Lady Macbeth repeats her man's sentence in line 26 as a parallelism When you durst to do it, then you were a man, and, to be more than what you were, you would be so much more the man.
It is also a kind of klimaxclimax because she increases the man (l. 26) to more than a man (l. 28).
With this she manipulates his husband, by telling him he would be more man if he kills DocanDuncan.
So Macbeth really wants to get this nomination of more than a man and thinks it is okay to proofprove his abilitysabilities as a man.
The woman also weaksweakens his argument from line 21 following.
In line 39 Lady Macbeth tells him they fail but if he is brave then they will not fail.
It is an antithesis and it tells Macbeth that it is in his force to not make this plan fail by risking some things.
So she lets the question open to him if they fail or not and gives him the feeling that he has the chance to decide if the plan will work or not.
The woman uses a parenthesis in line 42 following.
It emphasizeemphasizes that DuncansDuncan's sleep has to be very deep because of the hard journey he has behind him.
She wants to take MacbethsMacbeth's fear of failing by telling him that Duncan sleeps and wontwon't notice him while he kills him.

The simile in line 49 Their drenched nature lie as in a death should also calm the thraneThane down of his fear of getting caught because she means with this, that the servants seem like they are deathdead when they are drunk, so again the husband has no reason to worry about them.
In many parts of her talking she uses her language to manipulate Macbeth.

She puts her opinion and the reproaches into questions so she does not directly insults her husband but putputs him in mind he will be very cowardly and not a real man if he wontwon't do what he said.
All in all it can be sum up that Lady Macbeth tries to convince his partner by manipulating his mindset.
She makes him feel safe with the situation and persuades him with telling him he is not brave if he wontwon't kill the King.
